abstract: This discussion of Latin America and the Caribbean's legal tradition, steeped in baroque scholasticism, is especially apt in the uber-baroque, colonial dream of a city of Puebla, Mexico, filled with exuberant baroque churches and homes decorated with colorful tile, plaster curlicues and wrought-iron balconies.
title: El derecho indiano y la escolstica barroca: una lectura fresca y actual de los emblemas de Juan de Solorzano y Pereira
subject: law
